description: Equivalent of the Kurepa hypothesis for left factorial.
comments: For a prime p>2 we have !p == -a(p) mod p, where the left factorial !n = sum_{k=0..n-1} k! (A003422).
links: James Spahlinger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..100
Romeo Mestrovic, Variations of Kurepa's left factorial hypothesis, arXiv preprint arXiv:1312.7037 [math.NT], 2013.
prog: (MAGMA) [n eq 3 select -4 else -(n-3)*Self(n-3)-2*(n-1): n in [3..30]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 22 2016
author: Aleksandar Petojevic (apetoje(AT)ptt.yu), Jul 31 2000
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Oct 03 2000
